  • 2003-09-14 12:28:35

    Add Top Level Page

    On Add Top Level Page, if I type the Title and body, i can create a new page. but if I try to add content by Paste From File, it will not upload.

    I set the content folder to 777 (recursively) thinking that this might be the problem but no luck.

    Any ideas?

    thanks
    larry


  • 2003-09-14 12:57:31

    What are you uploading

    The paste from file function imports either valid HTML files or text files. It does not upload the file. It pastes it into the title/body areas, after which you must click the Add Content button.

    Please read:
    http://www.atutor.ca/forums/view.php?fid=7;pid=149


  • 2003-09-14 13:10:09

    Add Top Level Page

    Thanks Greg

    The define(\'CACHE_DIR\', \'/temp\'); was commented out in the config.inc.php file. I assume it should have the // removed.

    Is temp the appropriate location for Mac OS X?

  • 2003-09-14 16:15:01

    HTML parsing problem in Mac php?

    It seems to be related to the complexity of the html being saved. Could be a regular expression bug in Mac php, not liking something about the html.

    I was able to import some simple html and it saved ok. Importing worked fine but the file would not save when a complex html page was imported. Pasting the same html manually gave me the same result.

    We will add it to the list, but it's far down the list, so you may want to try tackling it yourself. Or, limit the complexity of your html until we figure it out.

  • 2003-09-15 12:29:06

    Probably a Mac/PHP problem

    I suspect the ATutor code is fine, but the problem lies in the Mac implementation of PHP. There is no problem pasting and saving from files on other OSs. We will likely have to create a workaround for Mac, or wait for the problem to be fixed in PHP.

    Where you place your images will depend on where they are located relative to the file in the original version of the page. We generally create a directory called images/ at the top level of the filemanager directory tree. Then link to thise files with:

    CONTENT_DIR/image/myimage.gif

    Which rollovers are you referring to. ATutor mouseovers seem to work fine.

    [reply][b]In reply to:[/b]
    It is strange that the code was accepted and worked on www.opensourcecms.com ... but that would not be a Mac OS X box.

    I pasted the code (that I would import into the body) directly into the mySQL ...
    [op]forums/view.php?fid=7;pid=414;page=1#422[/op][/reply]

    Probably a Mac/PHP problem

    The app I used to create the html uses Resources by default ... so I placed the images into that folder (which is also part of your schema) and they came in fine.

    The rollovers are part of the html code of the webpage that I pasted in the mySQL database.

    When I get a chance, i'll install on another Mac OS X box and see if the upload/import of html works any better.

  • 2003-09-20 07:07:25

    Still curious

    Greg:

    Should whatever appears in the text box not just be imported into the TEXT field of the CONTENT database when adding a top level (or other level) page? The complexity of the html should have little to do with it, I would think.

    Does it not go in to this field as text (0s and 1s) and is not acted upon in terms of html output until it appears in the ATutor course content window?

    The fact that it works when pasted into mySQL and displayed in ATutor illustrates that the display part is not the issue.

    Of the three LMS solutions that I looked at, I think ATutor can best meet my needs (and that's coming from a former Claroline user) ... but this issue will make it difficult to get course authors to submit their content directly into the system.

    Thanks in advance

    ......
    On an unrelated matter, do you know if there is an issue with .css pages and Mac OS X IE? I modified graphics for chrome.css and they display fine on Win IE, Safari (Mac OS X), but not Mac OS X IE. Strange!

  • 2003-09-20 08:30:28

    Its Mac Specific

    This paste problem only seems to happen when using a MAC server. I agree that it is not likely the ATutor code that's the problem, its likely the MAC version of PHP. I can't say for sure without some investigation.

    We do not have a MAC server running so we are unable to research the problem. I'd like to say we'll try to fix it, but its going to take time, which we can't spare at the moment, and equipment, which is not in our budget.

    I encourage you to do the investigation yourself, and contribute your findings to ATutor for the benefit of other MAC users.

    [reply][b]In reply to:[/b]

    Re: How to go about installing gadgets

    see:
